meanings.def: covering or affecting the whole world
examples: This year the global economy will grow by about 4 per cent.
the struggle to stay competitive in global markets
the country's ability to compete on a global scale
the global ban on commercial whaling
a global network of 64 national, regional and international organizations

meanings.def: considering or including all parts of something
examples: We need to take a more global approach to the problem.
They sent a global email to all staff.

meanings.def: operating or applying through the whole of a file, program, etc.
examples: We ran a global search on the database.
